posts.text:
Both the human brain and body, much like mycelial networks, dynamically sculpt their architecture through activity-dependent processes: high energy flow and usage reinforce and expand connections, pathways, and tissues, while low or absent activity triggers weakening, pruning, or regression—optimizing structure for efficiency and minimal metabolic waste in response to real-time demands.

We are a biological supercomputer that operates with a distributed network.  Our consciousness forms as a collaboration of cellular communication.
posts.author: BambroughKevin

posts.text:
You have never occupied the exact same space twice.

The sun isn't a stationary campfire—it’s a bullet tearing through the Milky Way at 500,000 miles per hour, dragging our entire world into the unknown.
posts.author: BambroughKevin
